"**I 'm Lovin' It**" is a song recorded by American singer-songwriter [Justin
Timberlake](/wiki/Justin_Timberlake "Justin Timberlake"). The song was
produced by [The Neptunes](/wiki/The_Neptunes "The Neptunes") and is credited
as being written by [Pharrell Williams](/wiki/Pharrell_Williams "Pharrell
Williams"), Tom Batoy, Andreas Forberger and Franco Tortora[1].

The song was written as a jingle for [McDonald's](/wiki/McDonald%27s
"McDonald's") commercials, based on a pre-existing German campaign originally
developed as "Ich Liebe Es."[2] Timberlake was paid $6 million to sing the
jingle. Soon thereafter, the Neptunes produced a song based on the jingle and
released it (along with an instrumental version) as part of a three-track
[EP](/wiki/Extended_play "Extended play") in November 2003. A digital download
EP with the same name was also released through the [iTunes
Store](/wiki/ITunes_Store "ITunes Store") on December 16, 2003. The extended
play included the title-track and a remix for all of the singles from
Timberlake's first solo studio album, _[Justified](/wiki/Justified_\(album\)
"Justified \(album\)")_.[3] The song was also included on the bonus audio CD
of Timberlake's first live DVD, _[Live From
London](/wiki/Justin_Timberlake:_Live_from_London "Justin Timberlake: Live
from London")_.[2]

A music video to promote the single was released in late 2003 and was directed
by [Paul Hunter](/wiki/Paul_Hunter_\(director\) "Paul Hunter \(director\)").

Rapper [Pusha T](/wiki/Pusha_T "Pusha T") revealed his involvement with the
song in June 2016 and claimed that he had created the "I'm Lovin' It"
jingle.[1] However, co-writers Batoy and Tortora, as well as several others
involved with the jingle's creation, have disputed his claim.[1]
